benchmark_details.name: EDITVAL
benchmark_details.overview: EDITVAL is a standardized benchmark for quantitatively evaluating text-guided image editing methods, consisting of a curated dataset of images, editable attributes, and an automated evaluation pipeline using pre-trained vision-language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating text-guided image editing methods across various edit types.

data.annotation: Manual annotation and validation by human raters

methodology.calculation: Automated metrics evaluate image fidelity using vision-language models and human evaluation assesses the quality of edits based on predefined criteria.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better fidelity of image edits to original properties and successful application of edits.
methodology.baseline_results: Instruct-Pix2Pix, Null-Text, and SINE are top-performing methods.
methodology.validation: Convergence between automated evaluations and human assessments confirmed through correlation studies.

targeted_risks.harm: Failures in spatial edits leading to inconsistent edited images.
